Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter John Rajkowski was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt:
1:05 pm cases called. 13CM442, 13JC11, 13JC12, 13JC13, 16TR830, 16TR831 & 16CF54. Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motions on file and decision needing to be made. Court denies motion for dismissal or amendment as filed by the defendant. Amended Information addressed. Attorney Rashid confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Entry of plea.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and Dismisses and reads-in Counts 3, 4, 5, 16TR830 & 16TR831.  Statement by DA Blader on behalf of the victim. Argument by DA Blader re: sentence. Statement by Attorney Rashid. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 88 days WCJ, with Good Time Credit. Credit for 66 days served. $1,429.00 fine inclusive of costs plus $42.50 blood draw costs- to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 18 month DL revocation, 18 month IID-effective today. OWI Assessment prior to licensing. AODA and follow through, Absolute sobriety, No bars, defendant not to possess nor ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription from a treating physician. Maintain full-time employment, Terms of Agent.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given. 
Statement regarding failure to pay cases: Attorney Zouski requests seek work order. Court orders a seek work order for 5 jobs each week. Defendant is to provide a current mailing address to Child Support. Return to court on July 27, 2016. Statement about 13CM442-$25 per month commencing July 1, 2016.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 12:15 pm.

13CM442, 16CF54, 16TR830, 16TR831 and other matters called at 12:45 pm. Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding matter on calendar for today. ADA Anderson makes a statement regarding defendant's motion. Statement by Attorney Rashid regarding recitation of agreement. Court makes statement to counsel regarding pending motion before the court. ADA Anderson makes further statement regarding motion. Statement by Court re-sets matter to be heard on 5/25/16 at 12:15 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 12:15 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 18, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

Court sets all matter for May 18, 2016 at 12:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

16CF54, 13CM442, 13JC11, 13JC12, 13JC13 Cases called @ 1:24 p.m. Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ruth Zouski appeared for the Child Support Agency. 16CF54 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT.  Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   NGP entered as to all counts. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 02:40 pm. Fail to pay matter and CSUP issues to track along with the criminal matter.
Initial appearance on March 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant and SPD Szilagyi

Case Called @ 1:03 PM: Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Defendant Peter John Rajkowski in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  ADA argues for cash bond of $1000 w/conditions based upon outstanding warrants and allegations of injury.  Inherent flight risk exists.  Argument as to bond request by SPD - argues for $100 cash as employment has been secured.  Significant financial responsibilities exists despite this bond.  Def is relatively indigent.  The Court:  Takes into account the probable cause statement and views flight risk exists.  Orders $1000 cash bond with conditions as requested.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
